title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-01958[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-01958 fits a MacBook Air computer from year Early 2020 whose model number is A2179 with a screen size of 13" and an EMC number of EMC 3302 [/INST]</s> no audio
message:
Audio board and flex had liquid damage and MacBook wont turn on. Flex and board replaced and boot but there is no audio.
Tested with three audio boards and flexes.

There is in setting output device.
When press vol up/down I see it on screen.
Mic works fine.
Audio works fine via hedphone jask socket.

There was short on [CAPACITORS]C6408[/CAPACITORS] - replaced [CHIPS]U6400[/CHIPS], short is gone, issue with audio the same.

J6100 in diode mode looks good.

Tested with known good speakers as well - same issue.

Any idea?

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-01958[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-01958 fits a MacBook Air computer from year Early 2020 whose model number is A2179 with a screen size of 13" and an EMC number of EMC 3302 [/INST]</s> no audio
message:
Very likely T2 internal damage.
Check diode mode to ground at [SIGNAL_NAMES]SPKRAMP_RESET_L[/SIGNAL_NAMES] and [SIGNAL_NAMES]SPKRAMP_INT_L[/SIGNAL_NAMES].

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-01958[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-01958 fits a MacBook Air computer from year Early 2020 whose model number is A2179 with a screen size of 13" and an EMC number of EMC 3302 [/INST]</s> no audio

<s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-01958[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-01958 fits a MacBook Air computer from year Early 2020 whose model number is A2179 with a screen size of 13" and an EMC number of EMC 3302 [/INST]</s> no audio
message:
Check voltage too and compare with working board.
Need to have audio board connected.

message:
[USER=73]@ajdoc[/USER] hi
I would like to have an update on what exactly was wrong in your case? cause I currently have an exact issue of yours.
